## Variance and Volatility of a Three‑Asset Portfolio ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(202) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) # Random weights summing to 1 w1 <- runif(1, 0, 1) w2 <- runif(1, 0, 1 - w1) w3 <- 1 - w1 - w2 # Volatilities (% per year) sd1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 15, sd = 3) sd2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 20, sd = 4) sd3 <- rnorm(1, mean = 25, sd = 5) # Correlations between assets rho12 <- runif(1, -0.2, 0.8) rho13 <- runif(1, -0.2, 0.8) rho23 <- runif(1, -0.2, 0.8) # Compute variance and standard deviation (squared %) var_port <- w1^2 * sd1^2 + w2^2 * sd2^2 + w3^2 * sd3^2 + 2*w1*w2*sd1*sd2*rho12 + 2*w1*w3*sd1*sd3*rho13 + 2*w2*w3*sd2*sd3*rho23 sd_port <- sqrt(var_port) ``` ::: You invest **12.89%**, **58.38%**, and **28.73%** of your funds in three assets with volatilities **13.68%**, **18.65%**, and **20.76%**, respectively. The pairwise correlations are ρ₁₂ = **0.24**, ρ₁₃ = **0.44**, and ρ₂₃ = **-0.12**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Variance = Σwᵢ²σᵢ² + 2Σ wᵢwⱼσᵢσⱼρᵢⱼ = **159.82**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Standard deviation = √(variance) = **12.64**%.
